description: Document every customer interaction in a standardized format to identify recurring pain points that become your product roadmap
notes: Video: How to Build a Business That Works | Shi heng yi Wisdom, Channel: Shi Heng Yi, Category: business_wisdom, Content: Document every customer interaction in a standardized format to identify recurring pain points that become your product roadmap

description: Create weekly 'fire drill' scenarios where you simulate being unavailable to identify which processes break without your direct involvement
notes: Video: How to Build a Business That Works | Shi heng yi Wisdom, Channel: Shi Heng Yi, Category: business_wisdom, Content: Create weekly 'fire drill' scenarios where you simulate being unavailable to identify which processes break without your direct involvement

description: Schedule quarterly 'business autopsy' sessions where you analyze what would happen if you disappeared for 3 months
notes: Video: How to Build a Business That Works | Shi heng yi Wisdom, Channel: Shi Heng Yi, Category: business_wisdom, Content: Schedule quarterly 'business autopsy' sessions where you analyze what would happen if you disappeared for 3 months

description: Target markets where incumbents have 5+ year technology debt and can't pivot quickly without disrupting existing revenue streams
notes: Video: The 7 Startup Strategies To Beat Big Competitors, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: startup_strategy, Content: Target markets where incumbents have 5+ year technology debt and can't pivot quickly without disrupting existing revenue streams

description: Build network effects by requiring users to invite 3 colleagues before accessing premium features, creating viral growth loops
notes: Video: The 7 Startup Strategies To Beat Big Competitors, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: startup_strategy, Content: Build network effects by requiring users to invite 3 colleagues before accessing premium features, creating viral growth loops

description: Use API-first architecture to let competitors integrate your core functionality, making them dependent on your platform
notes: Video: The 7 Startup Strategies To Beat Big Competitors, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: startup_strategy, Content: Use API-first architecture to let competitors integrate your core functionality, making them dependent on your platform

description: Create a 'not-to-do' list that's 3x longer than your to-do list to prevent strategic drift and resource dilution
notes: Video: How to Develop Business Strategy for Your Business, Channel: Business School 101, Category: strategy, Content: Create a 'not-to-do' list that's 3x longer than your to-do list to prevent strategic drift and resource dilution

description: Map your core competencies on a 2x2 matrix against market demand to identify where you should double down vs. divest
notes: Video: How to Develop Business Strategy for Your Business, Channel: Business School 101, Category: strategy, Content: Map your core competencies on a 2x2 matrix against market demand to identify where you should double down vs. divest

description: Implement quarterly strategy reviews where you must kill one existing initiative before starting any new ones
notes: Video: How to Develop Business Strategy for Your Business, Channel: Business School 101, Category: strategy, Content: Implement quarterly strategy reviews where you must kill one existing initiative before starting any new ones

description: Start with problems you've personally paid money to solve, not problems you think others have based on surveys
notes: Video: The Complete Guide to Startups, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: startup_fundamentals, Content: Start with problems you've personally paid money to solve, not problems you think others have based on surveys

description: Build features that users would pay for even if your company disappeared tomorrow, not nice-to-have features
notes: Video: The Complete Guide to Startups, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: startup_fundamentals, Content: Build features that users would pay for even if your company disappeared tomorrow, not nice-to-have features

description: Track cohort retention by week 1, week 4, and week 12 to identify which user segments have genuine product-market fit
notes: Video: The Complete Guide to Startups, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: startup_fundamentals, Content: Track cohort retention by week 1, week 4, and week 12 to identify which user segments have genuine product-market fit

description: Raise funding when you have 6+ months of runway remaining, not when you're 2 months from running out of cash
notes: Video: How to Raise Startup Funding: EVERYTHING You Need to Know, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: fundraising, Content: Raise funding when you have 6+ months of runway remaining, not when you're 2 months from running out of cash

description: Choose investors who have successfully backed companies in your exact space, not just generalist VCs with deep pockets
notes: Video: How to Raise Startup Funding: EVERYTHING You Need to Know, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: fundraising, Content: Choose investors who have successfully backed companies in your exact space, not just generalist VCs with deep pockets

description: Create a 'sales playbook' documenting every objection and response that actually works, not generic sales scripts
notes: Video: The Sales Playbook for Founders | Startup School, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: sales, Content: Create a 'sales playbook' documenting every objection and response that actually works, not generic sales scripts

notes: Video: The Sales Playbook for Founders | Startup School, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: sales, Content: Implement a 'customer success score' that measures how much value each customer derives from your product

notes: Video: How I Built a SaaS Startup (From Idea to Revenue), Channel: Indie Hackers, Category: saas, Content: Share your startup journey publicly on Twitter/LinkedIn to attract potential customers who are facing the same problems

notes: Video: How do startup exits work?, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: exits, Content: Focus on building recurring revenue streams that continue generating cash even if you stop actively selling

description: Understand that strategic acquirers pay 3-5x more than financial buyers for companies that fill a specific gap in their portfolio
notes: Video: How do startup exits work?, Channel: Y Combinator, Category: exits, Content: Understand that strategic acquirers pay 3-5x more than financial buyers for companies that fill a specific gap in their portfolio
